intro: Hieracium poeverleinii, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium poeverleinii is known for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its habitat.
